component.name: ClashCross
component.summary: ClashCross is a debugging application built on the Clash core, supporting Linux.

description.p: ClashCross is a proxy debugging application built on the Clash core. We do not provide any services for it, so please refrain from giving feedback on any issues not related to the application's own usage. This is an all-in-one network assistant! It can provide you with secure local HTTP/HTTPS/SOCKS servers, ensuring the safety of your authentication.
But that's not all, it also supports protocols like VMess, Shadowsocks, Trojan, Snell, and more. This means you can easily connect remotely to various servers, no matter which protocol you need!

It doesn't stop at just connections. This tool comes with a built-in DNS server, which minimizes the impact of DNS pollution attacks and supports DoH/DoT upstream and fake IP functionality, making your network even more secure and reliable.
And wait, there's more! You can set up rules based on domains, GEOIP, IPCIDR, or processes, enabling intelligent packet forwarding to different nodes for more efficient network traffic.

Moreover, if you need further customization, you can use remote groups to implement powerful rules such as automatic fallback, load balancing, or even automatic node selection based on closing latencyâ€”everything you need!
There's still more to come! Say goodbye to hardcoding node lists in configurations, as this tool supports remote providers, allowing you to effortlessly fetch node lists remotely.
For added convenience in deployment, it also supports Netfilter TCP redirection, making it easy to deploy Clash on your Internet gateway using iptables.
Last but not least, it even offers a comprehensive HTTP RESTful API controller, allowing you to control various functions through APIs. It's incredibly powerful!

In summary, this all-around network assistant provides full functionality, helping you establish a secure and efficient network environment. It's an indispensable and reliable tool for your online life!
To run on Flathub, you must manually set up the system proxy. This is determined by the Flathub mechanism.
